Hey Tom:

Is HERITRIX_HOME set?

Otherwise, missing from your stdout/stderr output are the usual:

23:20:43.884 EVENT Starting Jetty/4.2.23
23:20:44.956 EVENT Started WebApplicationContext[/,Heritrix Console]
23:20:45.328 EVENT Started SocketListener on 0.0.0.0:8888
23:20:45.331 EVENT Started org.mortbay.jetty.Server@c01e99
11/02/2005 23:20:57 +0000 INFO org.archive.crawler.Heritrix postRegister 
org.archive.crawler:guiport=8888,host=debord,jmxport=8849,name=Heritrix,type=Service 
registered to MBeanServerId=debord_1130973642610, 
SpecificationVersion=1.2 Maintenance Release, 
ImplementationVersion=1.5.0-b64, SpecificationVendor=Sun Microsystems
Heritrix @VERSION@ is running.
Web console is at: http://debord:8888
Web console login and password: admin/letmein
Crawler set to run mode.
etc..

The startup java code writes this out to the dmesg file. As soon as 
anything is written to the dmesg file, the wrapper script hands off 
control ot java in the belief that it can handle all from here on out 
(Whether successful start or failed start). If no dmesg output, then 
.............

Is the dmesg being written elsewhere (Thats why I ask about 
HERITRIX_HOME being set).

Do you see any output if you foreground the Heritrix startup:

% FOREGROUND=true ./bin/heritrix

Yours,
St.Ack


Tom Emerson wrote:

> Hi all,
>
> I'm trying to use artifact build heritrix-1.5.1-200511011835.tar.gz on
> a Solaris 10 (AMD64) machine using Java 1.5.0. On startup it never
> "completes"... just and endless maching line of '.' while I wait.
>
> heritrix_out.log, in its entirety, is:
>
> Thu Nov 3 07:36:17 EST 2005 Starting heritrix
> SunOS arachnophobia 5.10 Generic i86pc i386 i86pc
> java version "1.5.0_01"
> Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_01-b08)
> Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 1.5.0_01-b08, mixed mode)
> JAVA_OPTS= -Xmx256m
> core file size (blocks, -c) 0
> data seg size (kbytes, -d) unlimited
> file size (blocks, -f) unlimited
> open files (-n) 256
> pipe size (512 bytes, -p) 10
> stack size (kbytes, -s) 10240
> cpu time (seconds, -t) unlimited
> max user processes (-u) 16357
> virtual memory (kbytes, -v) unlimited
>
> HERITRIX_HOME and JAVA_HOME have both been set in my environment. I
> modified bin/heritrix to explicitly reference bash, since the default
> 'sh' on Solaris isn't fully compatible.
>
> I get the same behavior even if I set JMX_OPTS to the empty string.
>
> Interestingly, Heritrix *is* running: I can connect to the WUI, setup
> a crawl, and actuall perform one. But for whatever reason the dmesg
> file isn't being written right away, or at least not detected. I don't
> know if this is a shell issue or something else.
>
> -- 
> Tom Emerson Basis Technology Corp.
> Software Architect http://www.basistech.com
